body:
Hello @JustinZhengBC! Thanks for submitting the PR.

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/arrays/categorical.py`](https://github.com/JustinZhengBC/pandas/blob/d765dc33c2326778df30bee1c0046db75a837363/pandas/core/arrays/categorical.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/tests/indexes/test_category.py`](https://github.com/JustinZhengBC/pandas/blob/d765dc33c2326778df30bee1c0046db75a837363/pandas/tests/indexes/test_category.py) !

------

[Continue to review full report at Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/24275?src=pr&el=continue).
> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/24275?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [6111f64...82859d9](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/24275?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

I decided to go with @TomAugspurger's suggestion to just change the documentation. I did leave in one change in the function, because previously calling `np.take` would cause `NaN` values (represented by -1 in `self._codes`) to take the last element of `new_categories`.
